--- "jlindwall" <jlindwall@x> wrote:
> I'd like to be able to determine in tearDown() whether or
> not the test succeeded (eg, success, fail, or error).
> 
> If you're curious why: If the test failed I'd like to leave
> the database in it's current state to assist in manually
> determining what went wrong.  If the test succeeded I'd
> like to cleanup the db.

Consider this alternative:  Use a debugger breakpoint to stop after 
the failed test.  I find that I often set a breakpoint in a test 
that fails; then I rerun and step into the test to see what it's 
doing.  JUnit tests should generally be "deterministic."  That is, 
they should do the same thing each time.

Also consider this:  If you don't "clean up" at the end of this 
failed test, what effect will this have on all the tests run after 
this one?
